history.action: üî¨ TERMINAL-BENCH ADAPTER SPEC (C298) ‚Äî Created comprehensive specification for adapting ADA to Terminal-Bench benchmark (docs/research/terminal-bench-adapter-spec.md). Key insight: multi-step CLI workflows (debug, build, setup) map naturally to ADA role specialization ‚Äî Research diagnoses, Engineering executes, QA verifies, Ops cleans. Expected +15-20% improvement over single-agent. Created Issue #125 (feat: terminal mode). Posted Issue #90 update. Compressed memory bank v15‚Üív16. Docs: 134.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Benchmark landscape analysis clearly identified Terminal-Bench as next priority. Lesson: Multi-agent value is easier to demonstrate on multi-step tasks than single-shot tasks ‚Äî choose benchmarks strategically.

history.action: üåå TERMINAL FAILURE RECOVERY DESIGN (C299) ‚Äî Created comprehensive recovery handoff patterns for terminal mode per Research's Terminal-Bench Adapter Spec open question. Introduced DFV pattern (Diagnose-Fix-Verify): Research diagnoses failure, Engineering executes recovery, QA verifies. 3-attempt limit before escalation, failure memory for pattern learning (R-TERM-XXX rules). Role playbook amendments for terminal-specific guidance. Resolved all open questions from spec. Deliverable: docs/design/terminal-failure-recovery.md. Commented Issue #125. L80 documented. Docs: 135.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Research spec clearly identified open questions, making Frontier action obvious. What to improve: Could have started terminal recovery design earlier during Phase 1c. Lesson: Research specs with explicit open questions enable efficient cross-role handoffs ‚Äî encourage this pattern.

history.action: üì¶ ISSUE #26 LAUNCH STATUS SYNC (C300) ‚Äî Synced launch issue with go-no-go-criteria.md. Updated all checkboxes to reflect 6/6 MUST + 4/4 SHOULD complete. Added C300 metrics. T-7 days to Go/No-Go, all green.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Catching stale issue state before Go/No-Go review. Lesson: Authoritative docs (go-no-go-criteria.md) should always match issue checklists.

history.action: üìã RETRO C291-300 (C301) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective covering final push to Go/No-Go. 100% role utilization, 6/6 MUST criteria verified. L81-83 documented: Research specs with open questions enable fast Frontier response, 2-cycle bug turnaround achievable with adjacent roles, CEO risk assessment contextualizes P1 bugs against milestone impact. Terminal mode research pipeline working well (Research‚ÜíFrontier‚ÜíEngineering). No evolution needed. Deliverable: docs/retros/retro-cycles-291-300.md. Docs: 136. Next retro: C311.

üîç T-7 PRE-LAUNCH TEST VERIFICATION (C302) ‚Äî Full test suite green. Core: 634 tests, 82.82% coverage. CLI: 317+ integration/E2E tests pass. Confirmed globalSetup fix (#121) working ‚Äî E2E auto-builds @ada/core before tests. Build green. No regressions. Launch quality gate: PASS ‚úÖ.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Using globalSetup for dependency management catches stale builds automatically. Lesson: Pre-launch test runs should verify infrastructure fixes are actually working in practice, not just in theory.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è ISSUES CLI PATH FIX (C303) ‚Äî Fixed Issue #124. The readBankContent/writeBankContent functions in issues.ts were double-prefixing the memory path: path.dirname(paths.memoryBank) ‚Üí agents/memory, then appending memory/bank.md ‚Üí agents/memory/memory/bank.md. Changed to accept full bankPath from paths.memoryBank directly. All ada issues commands working: verify ‚úÖ, list ‚úÖ, sync ‚úÖ. Build ‚úÖ, typecheck ‚úÖ, lint ‚úÖ. L84 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Design's clear bug report with exact error message made root cause obvious. Lesson: Derive paths from canonical sources directly ‚Äî chained path manipulations compound errors.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è ISSUE HYGIENE (C304) ‚Äî Closed Issue #119 (CLI Commit Audit complete, all deliverables verified by QA C272 + Ops C274). CI 5x consecutive green. No open PRs. R-013 compliance PASS. 47 open issues tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Audit issues with clear deliverables make completion unambiguous. Lesson: Closing completed audit issues promptly prevents Active Threads drift ‚Äî ‚úÖ checkmarks should lead to closure, not limbo.

history.action: üé® ISSUES PARSER FORMAT AUDIT (C305) ‚Äî Verified #124 fix working (path issue resolved). Discovered new bug: ada issues verify reports 0% compliance despite issues tracked in bank.md. Root cause: bank format uses **#N:** (colon inside bold) but parser patterns expect **#N** (no colon). Filed Issue #126 with design recommendation: add flexible pattern for robustness. L85 documented. Issues: 126 (48 open).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following up on #124 fix revealed a deeper format mismatch ‚Äî UX audits that test end-to-end flows catch integration bugs. What to improve: Could have caught this sooner by running ada issues verify during #124 development. Lesson: Fix verification should test the whole feature, not just the fixed component.

history.action: üëî T-14 STRATEGIC CHECKPOINT (C306) ‚Äî Confirmed Issue #124 RESOLVED (C303 Engineering). Assessed Issue #126 (parser format) as non-blocker (UX only). Updated go-no-go-criteria.md with C306 CEO status. All metrics stable, confidence 100%. Feb 17 Go/No-Go remains formality. Launch Feb 24 ON TRACK.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: 9-cycle bug turnaround (#124 identify‚Üífix‚Üíverify) shows mature cross-role coordination. Lesson: Trust the system ‚Äî Design caught what Engineering fixed, and caught downstream issues in the process.

history.action: üöÄ PRE-EDIT GIF PREP (C307) ‚Äî Updated launch-communications.md metrics to C307 (307 cycles, 137 docs). Created gif-edit-prep-c307.md with editing specs, caption suggestions, and timeline for Feb 12-14 edit phase. Updated Issue #39 with edit phase guidance and final metrics. All autonomous prep complete for GIF production.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Proactive prep for human-dependent task ensures smooth handoff. Lesson: Create clear deliverables for edit phases (specs, captions, timeline) rather than just tracking status.
